# 4. Conclusion
In the dataset of 240 rows we have: 
- 5 Types of animals (Horse, Cattle, Sheep, Goat, Camel): every animal type has 48 descriptive rows
- Every of 48 rows per animal represents a year: from 1970 to 2017 and number of heads in thousands 
- there are no null values
- Number of camels 🐫 remains mostly the same, while horse 🐎 and cattle 🐄 heads number grow a little and sheep 🐏 and goat 🐐 heads number grow a lot **starting from early 1990s**.

# Overview

I love animals, and you?   
This is the only data I found on kaggle about farm animals: [Domesticated Animals in Mongolia 1970-2017](https://www.kaggle.com/robertritz/domesticated-animals-in-mongolia-19702017). The author says that Mongolia today faces desertification and land degradation. So let's check it out!

### What happened in the early 1990?
From the scatter plot below we can see that number of heads started to grow in the early 1990s. What happened? Yes, we all know that: communism fell and the course to democracy began which means the limits on amount and type of animals had been removed - that's why we see the growth. Mongolia today really faces desertification and land degradation   

Thanks to the author of dataset [Domesticated Animals in Mongolia 1970-2017](https://www.kaggle.com/robertritz/domesticated-animals-in-mongolia-19702017) 🐑🐑🐑. His article can be found [here](https://medium.com/mongolian-data-stories/goats-are-taking-over-the-steppe-12ff7cb21f14).
